alert.note: Alert for Estill; Lee; Menifee; Powell; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Powell, central Estill, Menifee, northwestern Lee and northwestern Wolfe Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pitts, or near Irvine, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pilot, Knowlton, See and Fixer around 500 PM EDT. Stanton, Rogers Chapel, Rosslyn, Standing Rock, Leeco and Zachariah around 505 PM EDT. Nada, Lombard, Slade, Bowen, Natural Bridge S.P., Glencairn, Cat Creek, Rogers and Torrent around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Haystack, Koomer Ridge Campground, Jenson, Pine Ridge, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Red River Gorge, Fagan, Tabor, Rothwell, Valeria, Cornwell, Frenchburg, Mariba, Denniston, Pomeroyton, Stoll and Sudith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
